com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core
Interface DependencyLink

All Superinterfaces:
DeployLink, DeployModelObject
public interface DependencyLink
extends DeployLink

A representation of the model object 'Capability Link'. Binds a Requirement to a Capability which satisfies it.

Dependency links are binary relationships. In the programming interface they are created by CoreFactory.createDependencyLink(). In the user interface, they are created by the DomainMatcher using thegetPossibleLinks methods. They may be extended to associate additional information with the binding. In such cases, the user must also modify the matcher to return descriptors that will create the required subtype.

The endpoints of the dependency links are serialized as topology paths obtained using DeployModelObject.getFullPath(). In the first release of the Topology Definition Model (TDM), the source of the dependency link is the containing requirement DeployModelObject.getParent(). In future versions, dependency links may be contained in an object that is different from the source, so users should use getSource() to obtain the requirement, rather than casting the result of DeployModelObject.getParent().

See Also:
CorePackage.getDependencyLink()

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getSource

Requirement getSource()
Returns the requirement source of the dependency link.

Returns:
a Requirement element which is the source of this link. Null will be returned in the case that no source was set. If a source was set but failed to resolve then a Requirement element will be returned with an error status. Be sure to check the status of the returned Requirement using the DeployModelObject.getStatus() method.

getTargetURI

java.lang.String getTargetURI()
Returns the unresolved URI of the dependency link target.

Users should invoke getTarget() to obtain the resolved target. This method will typically used to determine if there was a resolution error when getTarget() returns null

Specified by:
getTargetURI in interface DeployLink
Returns:
the URI to the target.
See Also:
CorePackage.getDeployLink_TargetURI()

getTarget

Capability getTarget()
Returns:
a Capability element which is the target of this link. Null will be returned in the case that no source was set. If a source was set but failed to resolve then a Capability element will be returned with an error status. Be sure to check the status of the returned Capability using the DeployModelObject.getStatus() method.

setTarget

void setTarget(Capability service)
This API is used to set the target element of this link to the passed Capability object.

Parameters:
service - - the Capability object that will be used as the target of this link.

setSource

void setSource(Requirement req)
This API is used to set the source element of this link to the passed Requirement object.

Parameters:
req - - the Requirement object that will be used as the source of this link.
